author: T Madhavan
text:
For well over a month now, development works to the tune of 8.31 crore are being carried out in Pallavaram Municipality and St. Thomas Mount Block in Kancheepuram district.

This information was shared by officials, after District Collector R. Gajalakshmi carried out a review of ongoing works recently.

The works include the Rs. 47-lakh urban primary health centre in Haridaspuram under ward 20 and the construction of a road bridge in Thirumalai Nagar under ward 19 of Pallavaram Municipality, which is being readied at an estimated cost of Rs. 38 lakh. During the inspection, she urged the municipal officials to ensure the projects were completed on time, without compromising on quality.

The Collector also inspected the modern guest house constructed at a cost of Rs. 6.62 crore in the St. Thomas Mount block. Also, the community hall that is being constructed at a cost of Rs. 30 lakh, a school building at Rs.22 lakh, a village panchayat e-seva centre in Nanmangalam village at Rs. 17 lakh, were inspected by the Collector, who ordered the speedy completion. Pallavaram Municipal Commissioner K. Sivakumar amd officials from rural development and panchayat raj were present during the inspection.
title: Kancheepuram Collector wants ongoing projects expedited
